question: Which two countries signed an agreement to develop the hydropower project?
explanation: Nepal and China signed an agreement to develop a 1,200-megawatt hydropower project, the country's largest to be built in central Nepal. It is being developed by China's Gezhouba Group Corporation and will cost around $ 2.5 million. This is the 2nd major hydro investment after China secured a deal early to develop a 750 Mega Watt project.
